thread.title: Justice League: Zack Snyder Teases Big Superman Role
thread.title_full: Justice League: Zack Snyder Teases Big Superman Role

title: Justice League: Zack Snyder Teases Big Superman Role
text:
Justice League: Zack Snyder Teases Big Superman Role - Tweet This 
Fans of Clark Kent might have been slightly disappointed to see their character meet an untimely end during the events of Batman v. Superman : Dawn of Justice, but thanks to Justice League director Zack Snyder , those same fans should still hold out hope to see their favorite character in Snyder's upcoming film. 
In scans released today from an upcoming issue of Empire, Snyder sat down with the magazine to give a preview of the upcoming Justice League movie. The feature also included a new picture of Batman, Wonder Woman, The Flash, and Cyborg, which we covered here . 
“Superman does play a big part in this movie,” Snyder told Empire. “His presence and lack of presence, are big story points…” 
If you recall, Superman and Doomsday seemingly killed each other at the end of Batman v. Superman in an ending that mirrored “The Death of Superman,” a big DC Comics storyline in 1992. While we didn’t see a full-on resurrection, we did see the dirt rise off of Clark Kent’s grave hinting that we haven’t seen the end of the Man of Steel. 
While we don't know the way in which Superman will return or his exact role in Justice League , we know the group will be facing Steppenwolf and Parademons as the primary antagonists. 
Justice League is directed by Zack Snyder, from a screenplay by Chris Terrio, and features an ensemble cast that includes Ben Affleck, Henry Cavill , Gal Gadot, Ezra Miller, Jason Momoa, Ray Fisher, Ciarán Hinds, Amy Adams, Diane Lane, Jeremy Irons and Jesse Eisenberg. 
Justice League is slated for release on November 11, 2017.
